definitions: wild plant with purple flowers and sharp prickly leaves and stems
examples: The thistle grew wild along the roadside fence
Scotland adopted the thistle as its national emblem

definitions: type of sandal held on by a Y-shaped strap between the toes
minimal underwear with thin strip of fabric at the back
examples: She wore comfortable thongs to the beach resort
The leather thong broke after years of use
Many people find thongs more comfortable than regular underwear
The store had a wide selection of thongs available

definitions: part of the body between the neck and abdomen containing heart and lungs
examples: The doctor examined the patient's thorax for breathing problems
X-rays showed no abnormalities in the thorax region

definitions: sharp pointed growth on stem or branch of plants like roses
examples: She pricked her finger on a rose thorn
The gardener wore gloves to protect against thorns

definitions: horse bred purely for racing from registered bloodlines over many generations
examples: The thoroughbred won three races this season
Only registered thoroughbreds can compete in certain races

definitions: main road or public street open at both ends for traffic
examples: The busy thoroughfare connected two major districts
Trucks were banned from the residential thoroughfare

definitions: number in position one thousand in a sequence or one part of thousand equal parts
examples: She finished in thousandth place among marathon runners
The measurement was accurate to the thousandth decimal

definitions: condition of being completely under someone's power or influence like a slave
examples: The audience was held in thrall by the performance
He remained in thrall to his addictive habits

definitions: act of beating violently or moving wildly with flailing motions
examples: The fish gave a final thrash before escaping
The storm caused a terrible thrash of waves

definitions: brown songbird with long curved bill found in North America
agricultural machine that separates grain from stalks by beating
examples: The brown thrasher sang from the garden hedge
We spotted a thrasher building its nest nearby
The old thrasher still worked despite its age
Farmers relied on the thrasher during harvest season

definitions: act of beating someone severely as punishment or in a fight
examples: The bully received a thrashing from older students
His poor performance earned him a verbal thrashing

definitions: cardinal number between two and four represented as 3
examples: The recipe calls for three cups of flour
She has three children attending the same school

definitions: group of three people engaged in an activity together
examples: The threesome played golf every Saturday morning
They formed a threesome for the group project

definitions: machine that separates grain from plant stalks by beating
large shark with distinctive long whip-like tail fin
examples: The farmer operated the thresher during harvest time
Modern threshers can process tons of grain daily
The thresher shark uses its tail to stun prey
Divers rarely encounter threshers in shallow waters

definitions: process of separating grain from harvested cereal plants by beating
examples: Threshing was traditionally done by hand with flails
The threshing continued throughout the harvest season

definitions: quality of using money and resources carefully without waste
examples: Her thrift allowed her to save for retirement
The family practiced thrift during difficult times

definitions: sudden feeling of excitement and pleasure from something stimulating
examples: The rollercoaster gave riders an incredible thrill
She felt a thrill when her name was announced

definitions: book, movie, or play with exciting plot full of suspense
examples: The psychological thriller kept audiences on edge
She enjoys reading thrillers before going to bed

definitions: steady rhythmic pain or sensation that pulses with the heartbeat
examples: The throbbing in his head lasted for hours
She felt a throbbing in her injured ankle

definitions: large densely packed crowd of people or animals
examples: A throng of fans waited outside the stadium
The throng pushed forward when doors opened

definitions: device controlling fuel flow to engine regulating vehicle speed
examples: The pilot adjusted the throttle for takeoff
The motorcycle's throttle responded instantly to touch

definitions: act of controlling or limiting flow of something like data or fuel
examples: Internet throttling reduced their download speeds significantly
The throttling of resources affected system performance

definitions: amount of material or data passing through a system or process per time unit
examples: The factory increased its throughput by twenty percent
Network throughput determines download speeds for users

definitions: item designed to be used once then discarded
examples: The party used throwaway plates and cups
This throwaway camera is perfect for vacation

definitions: person or thing that resembles something from an earlier time
examples: His style was a throwback to the seventies
The restaurant is a throwback to classic diners

definitions: person who throws something especially in sports or competitions
examples: The javelin thrower won the gold medal
She was the best discus thrower on the team

definitions: small to medium brown songbird known for spotted breast
fungal infection in mouth appearing as white patches
examples: The wood thrush sang beautifully at dawn
Several thrushes nested in our garden trees
The baby developed thrush after taking antibiotics
Thrush is common in infants and elderly patients

definitions: sudden strong forward push or movement of something
examples: The sword thrust missed its intended target
The rocket's thrust propelled it into orbit

definitions: small engine or motor providing thrust for maneuvering spacecraft or ships
examples: The spacecraft's thrusters adjusted its orbital position
Bow thrusters help large ships dock safely

definitions: action of pushing or driving forward with force
examples: The thrusting of tectonic plates causes earthquakes
His thrusting movements showed aggressive intent

definitions: major highway or expressway for high-speed traffic
examples: The thruway connects several major cities
Traffic on the thruway was heavy during rush hour

definitions: violent person who commits crimes especially robbery or assault
examples: The thug was arrested after the robbery
Local thugs terrorized the neighborhood for months

definitions: small version of larger image used as preview
nail on the thumb of a human hand
examples: Click the thumbnail to view the full image
The website displayed thumbnails of all photos
She painted her thumbnails with bright polish
His thumbnail was damaged in the accident

definitions: dull heavy sound made by impact of something solid
examples: We heard a loud thump from upstairs
The book fell with a thump on the floor

definitions: continuous heavy beating or pounding sound or action
examples: The thumping of the bass shook the walls
His thumping headache lasted all day long

definitions: loud rumbling sound in sky caused by lightning during storms
examples: Thunder rolled across the valley after lightning
The thunder frightened the young children inside

definitions: legendary bird in Native American mythology believed to create thunder
examples: The thunderbird appears in many tribal stories
They carved a thunderbird totem for the ceremony

definitions: flash of lightning accompanied by thunder especially when striking something
examples: A thunderbolt struck the old oak tree
The thunderbolt lit up the entire sky

definitions: storm with thunder and lightning typically producing heavy rain
examples: The thunderstorm knocked out power for hours
Weather forecasters predicted afternoon thunderstorms

definitions: structural crosspiece in a boat where rowers sit
examples: The rower sat on the middle thwart
They reinforced the thwart with new bolts

definitions: act of preventing someone from accomplishing their purpose or plan
examples: The thwarting of their plans frustrated everyone
Security focused on thwarting potential attacks

definitions: small aromatic herb with tiny leaves used in cooking
examples: Fresh thyme enhanced the roasted chicken flavor
She grew thyme in her kitchen herb garden

definitions: butterfly-shaped gland in neck producing hormones regulating metabolism
examples: Her thyroid was checked during the examination
An overactive thyroid can cause weight loss

definitions: ornamental jeweled crown worn by women on formal occasions
examples: The bride wore a diamond tiara with her veil
Princess tiaras were displayed in the museum

definitions: habitual involuntary muscle spasm especially in the face
examples: His eye tic became worse during stressful situations
The facial tic was barely noticeable to others

definitions: small blood-sucking arachnid that attaches to animals
regular clicking sound made by clock or watch
mark used to indicate something is correct or complete
examples: The dog had a tick behind its ear
Hikers should check for ticks after walks
The clock's tick kept her awake at night
We could hear the tick of the timer
Put a tick next to completed items
The teacher placed ticks on correct answers

definitions: informal term for the human heart
electronic display showing continuous stock market prices
examples: His ticker was checked by the cardiologist
The old ticker keeps on beating strong
Traders watched the ticker for market changes
The ticker showed rising prices all morning
